articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Hamas leaders held a second day of truce talks with Egyptian and Qatari mediators on Sunday, with no apparent progress reported as the Islamist group maintained its demand that any agreement must end the war in Gaza, Palestinian officials said.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire talks continue in Cairo, Israel pounds the Palestinian enclave

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's cabinet decided on Sunday to shut down Al Jazeera's operations in Israel for as long as the war in Gaza continues, on the grounds the Qatari television network threatens national security.
articles.title: Israeli cabinet votes to shut down Al Jazeera's local operations

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Palestinian Islamist group Hamas on Sunday claimed responsibility for an attack on the Kerem Shalom crossing between Israel and Gaza that local media reports said resulted in Israeli casuatlies.
articles.title: Hamas claims responsibility for attack on Israel-Gaza border crossing, casualties reported

articles.author: Vitalii Hnidyi
articles.description: Russian attacks on Orthodox Easter Sunday killed a woman buried under rubble and injured 17 in Ukraine's northeastern city of Kharkiv and the surrounding region, regional officials said.
articles.title: Russian attacks on Kharkiv and region kill one, injure 17, officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike killed four members of a family in a house in a border village in southern Lebanon on Sunday, civil defence and security sources said.
articles.title: Four Lebanese civilians killed in Israeli strike on border village

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken will travel to Guatemala on Tuesday to lead a delegation to the a ministerial meeting of the Los Angeles Declaration on Migration and Protection, the State Department said on Sunday.
articles.title: Blinken to travel to Guatemala on Tuesday, US State Dept says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said on Sunday he had to be hospitalized again in the northern city of Manaus due to a skin infection caused by a bacteria, adding there is no forecast for when he could be discharged.
articles.title: Brazil ex-president Bolsonaro hospitalized again with skin infection

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The death toll from heavy rains that have inundated Brazil's southern state of Rio Grande do Sul has risen to at least 66, local authorities said on Sunday.
articles.title: Death toll from rains in southern Brazil climbs to 66, over 100 still missing

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: A top U.N. official on Sunday accused Israel of continuing to deny the United Nations humanitarian access in the Gaza Strip, where the U.N. food chief warned a "full-blown famine" has taken hold in the north of the enclave of 2.3 million people.
articles.title: UN accuses Israel of denying Gaza aid access as famine takes hold

articles.author: Raul Cortes, Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: The parents of an American and two Australian surfers presumed to have been killed in northern Mexico have arrived in the country and will try to identify the dead bodies believed to be their children, a Mexican regional official said on Sunday.
articles.title: Parents of US, Australian tourists presumed killed in Mexico to try identifying bodies
